title: Introduction to Machine Learning
content: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that focuses on building systems that learn from data. This guide covers supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and neural networks.
author: Dr. Sarah Chen

title: Advanced Python Programming Techniques
content: Advanced Python programming covers decorators, generators, context managers, metaclasses, and asynchronous programming patterns for building robust applications.
author: John Martinez

title: Database Design Best Practices
content: Database design involves normalization, indexing strategies, query optimization, and choosing the right database type for your application needs.
author: Emily Rodriguez

title: Cloud Computing Architecture Patterns
content: Cloud computing architecture patterns include microservices, serverless, container orchestration, and distributed system design principles.
author: Michael Kim

title: Microservices Design Principles
content: Microservices architecture breaks down applications into small, independent services that communicate via APIs, enabling scalability and maintainability.
author: Jessica Taylor

title: RESTful API Development Guide
content: RESTful APIs follow architectural constraints including statelessness, client-server separation, cacheability, and uniform interface design.
author: David Brown

title: DevOps and CI/CD Pipeline
content: DevOps practices combine development and operations, focusing on automation, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and monitoring.
author: Lisa Anderson

title: Data Science with Python
content: Data science involves statistical analysis, data visualization, machine learning, and extracting insights from large datasets using Python.
author: Robert Lee

title: Web Application Security
content: Web security covers authentication, authorization, encryption, SQL injection prevention, XSS protection, and CSRF mitigation.
author: Maria Garcia

title: Scalable System Design
content: Scalable system design addresses load balancing, caching strategies, database sharding, message queues, and fault tolerance.
author: James Wilson
